title: Google\Cloud\Build\V1\Secret
name: Secret
description:
Pairs a set of secret environment variables containing encrypted values with the Cloud KMS key to use to decrypt the value.

Note: Use kmsKeyName with available_secrets instead of using kmsKeyName with secret. For instructions see: https://cloud.google.com/cloud-build/docs/securing-builds/use-encrypted-credentials.

Generated from protobuf message google.devtools.cloudbuild.v1.Secret

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.kms_key_name
params.description: Cloud KMS key name to use to decrypt these envs.

params.name: data.secret_env
params.description: Map of environment variable name to its encrypted value. Secret environment variables must be unique across all of a build's secrets, and must be used by at least one build step. Values can be at most 64 KB in size. There can be at most 100 secret values across all of a build's secrets.

methods.name: getKmsKeyName
methods.description:
Cloud KMS key name to use to decrypt these envs.

Generated from protobuf field string kms_key_name = 1;

methods.description:
